column4: How the F did you reach hardware drivers without being able to use your keyboard nor mouse?
USB keyboard and mouse.. Now can you help?
do you have an answer or were you just curious?
do you have an answer or were you just curious?
Probably just curious. If only USB works, I'm wondering wether these usb-ports are on your mainboard or on a PCI card.
I'm not sure.. Everything worked great with 9.04 I did a complete reinstall with 9.10 and been having problems. I've been trying to fix it for 2 days now
Have you tried installing 9.04 and then upgrading to 9.10?
I can't get 9.04 to install
Then how did you install it previously?
I mean after installing 9.10 I can't get 9.04 to install again. It hangs up even if I try to run live cd
That's really odd. If your mouse and keyboard worked fine during the 9.10 installation, something might have gone wrong with your hardware.
Try using a live-usb. Wondering how that turns out.
they actually didn't work when it came to the screen to put in my info. I had to restart with USB keyboard and mouse. I was hoping it would work once installed
what is live-usb?
If you happen to have the 9.10 iso and a USB stick (I'd recommend at least 2GB of storage) go to system>Administration>USB Startup Disk Creator
thanks, I'll give that a shot

Have you tried using google to see if there are any other people dealing with the same issue and have the same motherboard? It's really odd that a 9.04 CD won't work after installing 9.10. And even more odd that usb works, but the old ports for keyboards and mice don't
yes, I've been searching for 2 days now with no luck
Alright. This is about as far as I can assist you from here. Goodluck on the usb-stick creation. If this doesn't work out, you might want to try the ubuntu forums.
Thank you for your help. Very much appreciated!
